description.narrative: The NIJR2 has two Strategic Objectives (SO1 and SO2): Objective 1: To alleviate human suffering through the effective and efficient implementation of humanitarian response activities by the Dutch NGOs. Objective 2: To generate added value through the collaboration between the NIJR2 members and other stakeholders.

This programming targets recently displaced IDP communities from Anbar (which make up 36% of IDPs in Sulaymaniyah and 29% of the IDPs in Kirkuk, which have both been prioritized by the 2015 HRP allocation paper), Kirkuk, Babylon, Baghdad, Diyala, Ninewa, and Salah al Din (which make up 22% of IDPs in Sulaymaniyah and 39% of IDPs in Kirkuk and were also prioritised by the 2015 HRP allocation paper). Among these persons of concern, WVI ensures access to services for most vulnerable individuals through activities of the mobile outreach clinics and household visits by the WAYCS and Health and Hygiene Promotion staff, in order to ensure that services target the most vulnerable groups, including female headed households, the elderly, people with disabilities, large families and individuals living in extreme poverty. The WAYCS also provide an accessible entry point for women, children and young people, including those with disability. All services are provided free of charge.

Within the NIJR2, World Vision contributes to the following result areas: Food Security & Livelihoods.R1: Save lives by ensuring that crisis affected families receive emergency food support and have access to balanced nutrition. Protection.R1: Provide immediate lifesaving assistance to newly-displaced or newly-accessible persons, regardless of location; immediately address the urgent protection needs of the most vulnerable among the population (including women, girls, boys, the elderly, disabled, and survivors of torture and sexual violence in conflict); and inform and improve the overall humanitarian emergency response through protection monitoring and assessments. Protection.R2: Identify and address protection needs in an on-going manner through expanded protection response networks among national and international actors and support existing service providers or, where necessary, direct service provision, to the affected populations. Protection.R3: Cultivate an environment for the respect of rights by addressing systemic challenges with immediate impact on the humanitarian response and strengthening national protection networks and systems to ensure protection services are increasingly owned and sustained by capable national stakeholders Health.R1: Provide life-saving health care services to prevent avoidable morbidity, mortality, and disability. Health.R2: Provide essential health care services. Health.R3: Provide comprehensive emergency services and strengthen national capacities WASH.R1: Provide assistance to emergency WASH men and women affected in accordance with the standards in the months following the outbreak of the crisis.
